text: The Japanese fluvial sculpin (Cottus pollux) is a species of fish in the family Cottidae. It is endemic to Japan, where it inhabits mountain streams in Honshu, Shikoku, and Kyushu. It reaches a maximum length of 15.0 cm (5.9 in) . ==References== Category:Fish of Japan Category:Cottus (fish) Category:Fish described in 1873 Category:Taxa named by Albert Günther
title: Japanese fluvial sculpin
